description: just had to copy the correct files into the directory, like the other comments said! thanks a lot to the developer you are great!
Could not get it to run but maybe you guys could add grand theft auto 5 to the app center it would be better than this game
You just need to give it permission to read your game files with --filesystem=/path/to/game/files

Disclaimer - You need a copy of Duke Nukem 3D for PC to use eduke32. I was able to purchase my copy from zoom-platform.com

Step 1: If not extracted already, use innoextract to extract the setup file of duke 3D. If the location is in the Downloads directory. Use these two commands:

cd Downloads
innoextract 'Duke-Nukem-3D-Atomic-Edition-Setup-1.3.exe'

Step 2: Inside the Duke Nukem 3D game folder, locate the 'DUKE3D.GRP' file and the 'DUKE.RTS' file. Copy both of these files into the path listed below: (use Ctrl+h to reveal the .var subdirectory.... then click each corresponding folder)

/.var/app/com.eduke32.EDuke32/.config/eduke32

Step 3: Click on the eduke32 launcher and play the game.
summary: Don't forget to copy your game files into the eduke32 directory!

description: Great work everyone - runs beautifully ! Place the needed game files in the right location and you are ready to go. Check your output and follow instructions for those having some difficulty.
you just have to download few more files from the web and put them in correct folder. that simple and the joy of playing that game brings back memories. Great work you all

I didnt have to download anything extra. All I had to do was install the original game in the correct folder and go threw the setup for controls and video options and Im playing the game with no issues what so ever. 
I really like it. I just got done playing it over for the 5th time threw dosox last time but its never looked this good before. I like the updates to the graphics and im playing on a laptop with a super crappy intel video card.
Just take the time and READ the manual to where to install the original game.

This works great, plays excellent on steam deck. Just remember to copy your duke3d.grp from the original game to one of the scanned folders (documents/Eduke32/ for example works fine)

Its a shame some people give this one star based on their own stupidity
summary: Dont forget to copy your duke3d.grp file

description: I decided to get this when I realized it had controller support and was surprised. It all works perfectly on default settings. It even detected the necessary game files from the Megaton Edition I had installed on Steam automatically, so I didnt have to do anything to make it run. Steam Deck user btw.

Flathub users must copy duke.rts and duke3d.grp files to default ~/Document/Eduke32/

Without copying files it will crash.

Short 2min play reveals stable and fast duke 3d. Nice..
even after putting duke.rts and duke3d.grp in ~/Documents/Eduke32/ it still crashes after the exact same amount of time everytime
...Der Klassiker läuft smoothly und lässt sich komplett durchspielen...

So many steps to done the TRUE Install
i could not make it done
а можно так сделать что бы хоть одна игра запустилась без танцев с бубном!
